page.title: 09INDUSTRY
page.content: Whisky manufacture provides the only secondary industry existing in the Pitlochry area . To make whisky you need water,yeast and malted barley . The water comes from the mountain Ben_y_Vrackie which is 2,750ft high.All they do to the water is filter it.Forty two thousand gallons of hot water and eight point six tons of malted barley are put in the mash tun.After the distillation process the whisky is put in oak sherry casks for a minimum of three years. My dad thinks it's good. The distillery employs 25 people. They have had to cut production but not jobs.There is also the Edradour distillery, star of the BBC programme King's Royal, quite old fashioned in outward appearance, but with some newly built gift shops. They hope to become part of the Whisky Trail chain.
